1.title: Happy Birthday
1.plot: On his birthday, Lou Hemingway hears of the death of his best friend, Izzy Durant. A recovering addict, before delivering Izzy's eulogy, Lou has his first drink in years. During the eulogy, he throws away his written speech and begins a brutally honest assessment of Izzy Durant's life, referring to him as a 'Tragic Clown'. The funeral attendees, who include the other characters of the series, have conflicting memories and opinions of Izzy's life as those expressed in Lou's impromptu speech.

2.title: Henry Street
2.plot: Impressed with Lou's urban survival skills, Tommy Machine accepts Lou invitation to accompany him on a break-in and robbery of several Henry Street businesses over the Fourth of July Holiday. The night before the heist, Lou introduces Tommy to Heroin. While high, the two men have a spontaneous sexual exchange. The next morning, confused and mortified with himself, Tommy backs out of the planned robbery without telling Lou, leaving him high and dry.

3.title: Fourth of July
3.plot: Norton Lombardi tells his pregnant wife Madeline that tonight he's going to Brooklyn to watch the fireworks with friends. In reality he is going to a clandestine meeting with his lover Chloe Naperiella. With a child on the way Norton feels his life is over. He makes a decision to leave Madeline and move in with Chloe.

4.title: An Empty Wallet Hangover
4.plot: Woken up by a threatening phone call giving him a day to pay up, Carmen D'Angelo spends the day scouring the Lower East Side trying to piece together enough loans to cover his expense, and piece together the events, which caused him to be hungover and with an empty wallet.

5.title: Loves Labors Lost
5.plot: While out drinking on the cheap, Tommy Machine, introduces his friend Norton Lombardi, to his future wife, Madeline Caldecott. That evening Norton gives Tommy permission to watch during a moment of intimacy, but when Tommy takes it upon himself to do more than watch, it puts a major strain on their friendship.

imdb.plot outline: Set in the Lower East Side of pre-9/11 Manhattan, Under Two Bridges celebrates the People, Places and Passions of the Lower East Side, the last bastion of Bohemianism on the Island of Manhattan. it is the series of 12 interlocking stories of nine men and woman on the fringes of society.
imdb.title: Under Two Bridges
plot: Set in the Lower East Side of pre-9/11 Manhattan, _Under Two Bridges_ (qv) celebrates the People, Places and Passions of the Lower East Side, the last bastion of Bohemianism on the Island of Manhattan. it is the series of 12 interlocking stories of nine men and woman on the fringes of society.::Mick Lexington
